wikipedia_page.main: Captain Guy Patrick Spence Reid  (18 May 1897 – 16 October 1917) was a British World War I flying ace credited with five aerial victories.

response: The recent addition of a modern carving of the Madonna and Child maintains the creative link between the church and the arts. It was sculpted by Guy Reid, a former Artist in Residence at St Matthew's.

link_mentions.page: List of World War I flying aces from the British Empire
